website_summaries.verdict: An affordable mixing alternative to the common, more expensive DJ controller setup.
pros: Comes with eight separate inputs with individual volume and equalization knobs
Offers a wide variety of output jacks for most audio systems
Features two studio-grade XENYX mic pre-amps and “British” channel EQ
Extremely small, durable, and portable for travel

customer_reviews.title: Does not function properly for streamers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to replace the monstrous footprint of the Behringer Xenyx 1204FX. As a streamer, I wanted a little more room for other gear on my desktop. Unfortunately, the mixer is extremely limited. You can't run audio to your headphones while using the USB connection (which doesn't make any sense to me at all). What's worse -- Behringer knows this is a limitation but doesn't make a note of it anywhere in the descriptions of the product. Do yourself a favor and splurge on something a little more powerful than this thing. It has a small footprint, but the limitations are simply not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Loved, it
customer_reviews.text: Loved, it. Actually bought two. Then one day during a lives stream my board just start smoking and burned out. Only 4 months old. Of course no warranty to replace it. :/ I used to recommend them to all my website visitors, not again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I had one that lasted me 6+ years and it took a beating on the road, so when it died I was quick to buy a new one. For the price, this is a great practice tool! I use it on stage for a personal in-ear system, and for practicing and rehearsing so I can hear more clearly. I have also used it for small acoustic gigs, hooking it up to powered speakers. I have used it for live recordings and it turned out well. Is it GREAT? No, but it absolutely works, and for the price its totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Product failed in 6 months with no way to contact company
customer_reviews.text: The unit failed after occasional use for 6 months. Then I found there was no way to contact the company for product support other than a web site that reject every attempt to submit a technical support request. Since there is no phone number or email address to contact, there is no way find out why it is rejecting all attempts to create a support ticket. This was a total waste of money and time. If you want an unreliable product with horrible support, this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: G. Aumaugher

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I be / we have used this inside and outside. Impeccable Quality!!! I’ve used it in a small area I’ve used it in banquet rooms at hotels! Yes no matter the size of the room this equipment has stepped up to the plate and showed out! Meaning it has outstanding performance no matter where you’re using it. I now have it as my backup because of the need for more mic usage I purchased it’s big brother so I could add more usage mics guitars and keyboard! I’d refer this equipment to anyone who has a need. It’s versatile sturdy & reliable, it’s mobility for me is on point. I’d buy this again should the need arise!
customer_reviews.author: DChamp

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but get the USB one instead
customer_reviews.text: This is the sound board I use. Be warned though, you want the other one that comes with USB already ready. They sell it. In order to connect this to my iMacPro I have to have a UCA222 which is another order and more money that I didn't need to spend if I had payed attention and bought the right sound board to start with. "Stuff I Heard" podcast in case you want to check it out. I put videos of this on my YouTube also.
customer_reviews.author: Deloris Peek

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer for the money
customer_reviews.text: A friend gave me an older version of this, and the new one works like a champ. However, the power cable has a really snug fit, so be careful. I'm not sure why Behringer has continued to use this connector, because the reason I got the older one is because the power connector broke. I ended up soldering the old one together. When I opened this one and saw the same connector, I was admittedly confused. It's a definite design flaw. That said, I have no plans of moving this thing around, so it's not a huge deal for me. Just be aware that the power cable may not stand the test of time if you constantly mess with it.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great For Basic DJ Rig
customer_reviews.text: I DJ weddings and events. I’m usually running 2 microphones, DJ controller, 2 speakers and a sub. Previously had the Behringer 502 mixer and decided to upgrade to this one after struggling to control microphone feedback for a long time. This instantly solved all those issues because I was now able to do proper gain staging (the 502 doesn’t have channel gains, just the fader). It’s still small enough to fit with my current rig and gives me adequate channels to work with in a basic setup. Sound feels adequate for my crowds. I feel like I get great sound out of it and usually don’t even push it past halfway.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Beastwood

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: For my rehearsals at home, I needed to add mics to the amp I had, but I didn't want to spend much money. This little mixer is cheap but powerful. I can connect several items and play with the equalizer and gain to get and improved sound. I noticed that the weight of the cables would easily pull it from the coffee table where I placed it, but I hold it with 2 rubber bands and now it stays in place. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Victor R.

customer_reviews.title: Afordable, reliable, perfect for aspiring home recording artists!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer. It is a replacement for the exact item that was several years old. I have used this mixer for many, many hours. Levels would fluctuate and and have to be reset. The new one works perfectly. Electronics age, components go out of spec. This mixer took a clubbing and performed flawlessly for many years. I have recorded in my home studio with impressive results. My talents may be wanting, but friends were impressed. My band consisting of me, myself and I sounded pretty good, if I must say so myself. This mixer is perfect for home aspiring artists. 5 stars hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Geneb53

customer_reviews.title: Great starter board for small studio
customer_reviews.text: Easy connections. Pretty self explanatory on that count. There are a significant number of YouTube videos to give directions on adjusting the balances and equalization , but most of the process after that is trial and error to get everything tweaked in. This board has plenty of capability for the beginner to intermediate home sound studio.
customer_reviews.author: wolfinwolfsclothing

customer_reviews.title: I replaced an older version of this exact mixer
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older version of this exact mixer. The one I replaced was a reliable mixer, it actually wasn't broken but just need a deep clean. Easier to replace. There were a few cosmetic changes, but essentially the same board. The older one lasted a long time. Only used at home for TV and some recording. But I'm giving it 4 stars because everything else I have ever owned by Behringer has broken. Hopefully this will hold up
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, returned
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a disappointment. The power plug sucks, and that is being nice. Would not stay in. Constantly coming unplugged. And mine wobbled also. The whole thing just felt cheap. Maybe not a bad mixer for the lower end of the spectrum, but for it it was not worth the $84 I paid, maybe worth more like $40. returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Pot meters unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd 802b I've bought. I thought I did something to the first one because some of the pot meters didn't work right. I bought another one, which has never been moved, and after a while it does the same thing. If I turn the master volume or some channels volume all the way down the sound keeps coming through. If I lightly tap the pot meter sometimes the sound will go off sometimes not. It is a mini mixer but the power supply is heavy and large. It also has a very unusual plug and power output so if it breaks your out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: H R Rumph

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as an audio interface for my computer. It works really well, however the amps do introduce a little bit of noise at high levels, so getting the inputs to sound just right is a bit of a balancing act between the gain level, channel level, and master level. Being able to mix all my input devices together into one stream is a great addition to my setup though, so I don't have to swap cables when changing inputs.
customer_reviews.author: Kaslai

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a great unit but if you need any power output at all definitely keep shopping.
customer_reviews.text: To start I honestly did not know what I was buying at the time because little information is given about this unit. It had nowhere near the power I needed but I never call seen anything that gave any kind of power rating.. seems to be a well-constructed unit but pointless for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: clark1

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is it's good to have such equipment that makes the music making ...
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is it's good to have such equipment that makes the music making process so much better. This is a great addition to connect your external gear up to your computer, also do invest in an internal sound card to enhance your recording experience. I've been recording since 1985, then by 1996 when home computers first came out, I went MAC first and bought piece like this one to connect my gear...Let's just say I put our amazing professional quality as a professional recording studio. Yes, it does help if you know what you're doing, but this little Behringer will do the job right.!!!!!!!! Get going, make your dreams come true.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Conelly

customer_reviews.title: great device for small home studio. sturdy piece of machine.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and feels well built for the price range of this Pre amp. has all the features you could want, i was planning on getting something more simple but it's actually useful manipulating channels through an analog device. pretty easy to figure out as long as you know a little bit about audio adapters. get a whole buncha quarter inch to rca adapters if you can to use with recording/stereo systems.
customer_reviews.author: Halfrotech

customer_reviews.title: Understand your purpose before buying this
customer_reviews.text: This has no usb connection. Or at least the model I received didn’t have one. This made simple voice recording a bit of a nightmare. I returned mine for a brand that is easier to use. There are workarounds for the problems I experienced, check you tube before you buy to understand more about why these issues are in detail.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole & Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for mixing microphones for guitar recording and it works great. It has zero noise and all the controls are smooth. Can't beat it for the price. The only issue I've experienced is the unit seems to be a little warped and does not lay completely flat on a desk, table, etc. However, I've put rubber feet on it and it's much better.
customer_reviews.author: FJK1138

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: this mixer is a duffer. the 2-track routing does not work properly and once the 48V power is turned on it won't turn off again. WTF is up at Behringer, they used to be good at this... this is the second mixer from Behringer that I have had to return this month.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R

customer_reviews.title: Power cable slips out!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how poorly the power cable fits into this device. It's so bad that the company should be embarrassed to release this product as is. I'm not exaggerating the power cord falls out constantly, they shouldn't be allowed to sell this product as it doesn't work within a reasonable expectation. Amazon's choice? 4 stars? HOW?!
customer_reviews.author: B.Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer for PC Recording
customer_reviews.text: I have only good things to say about this little mixer. It's a rather high quality build for the money, feeling like units costing many times more. The sound is awesome, and the ease of use couldn't be better. Right out of the box, it was like I had owned it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: other then that the sound quality is great easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have this exact unit I and three other friends have bought ....this unit gets the job done with no worries at all...if you need more then four Mics I would suggest getting a bigger mixer...other then that the sound quality is great easy to use...I liked it so much I bought a second...and if you ever damage the power supply they sell it right here on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DJ G Slimm

customer_reviews.title: Small set up, this works great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to practice and record a basic set up. Stereo backing track + microphone/Sax. Does everything I need it to and it sounds great. However, I will say I push effects to the sax outside this unit. If I wanted more choices for effects, I'd have gotten the 1002. Also really should have an off button. I manually unplug this because my power strip is buried and I can't just do it that way. I know a lot of guys have a power strip that they turn off, so this is the right solution for those guys.
customer_reviews.author: Durgin

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday and immediately unboxed. I was please and surprised at the size and beefiness of the board. I guess I was expecting it to be a little micro board and feel like a toy. It does not. It actually feels like a small piece of equipment. For the price I am happy with this purchase for home karoke, small jam sessions, outdoor theater and video editing. It will come in handy in multiple occassions for me. Edit: got new cables and properly connected and it now sounds amazing for a sub 100 mixer I am more than pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hemphill

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer for a small time DJ or dance party
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer for a small time DJ or dance party. Easy to use for a first time mixer, I'd never used one I figured it out pretty quickly. I used it to mix in/amplify an iPHONE w/ Spotify into an old surround sound receiver for music at a dance and added a MIC for announcements. Worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: PKS

customer_reviews.title: Basic mixer got the job done!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a musician or guru with music stuff, but this basic mixer help me with a audio video presentation and the sound was good easy to use and pack, so if your doing something simple, presentation, movie on the back yard with aux speakers this should be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: EscFam4

customer_reviews.title: Love this soundboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this soundboard! It does everything I need it to do as a beginner in recording live events. I'm going to have to upgrade one day, but until then, this thing is worth it's weight in gold!
customer_reviews.author: Curt L. Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this little mixer as a backup after a problem with my current rack mounted one. Bottom line, it sounds as good or better than the one it's supposed to backup. I have been a professional musician for 50 years. This could very well be the best piece of equipment for the least price ever. Well made - metal case, three band EQ, effects bus. Two mono channels with XLR jacks and two true stereo channels (both have L & R channel inputs). It makes me interested in checking out other Behringer products. In view of the price, I'd have to rate it 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Michael Walls

customer_reviews.title: Best soundboard around, would happily recommend and purchase another.
customer_reviews.text: Behringer sound boards have always been high quality and easy to use and this one is nice different. It provides the ability to mix and make adjustments to any sound system but be mobile. Actually used this for my wedding and it was perfect and flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I’m a musician for over 20 years I wouldn’t recommend very disappointing the sound is not good. I have top quality speakers and really surprised of how low behringer has gone. Usually get nice staff from them
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Power cord won't stay in
customer_reviews.text: I really like the features of this little beast, and for the price it would have been a great deal, except for the fatal flaw of the power cord...it doesn't plug in well, wiggles when all the way in, and disengaged once on me. (This is a common problem in other reviews, but I gave it a shot anyway). Also, there's no power ON/OFF switch, so you have to unplug the power cord just to turn off the unit. Lame. If they get this issue resolved, I would definitely buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Power supply caught on fire. Yay.
customer_reviews.text: Got about 1 month out of it before it literally caught on fire one morning. Warranty is going to cost more in shipping than buying something else. Behringer's high end stuff is nice. This is not.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tate

customer_reviews.title: No off switch?
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised at a reasonable price. My biggest gripe: it has no off switch?? Now why you got to go and design a consumer electronic with no off switch? So dumb. Other than that, it does what it’s supposed to. Except turn off.
customer_reviews.author: ToddlerDad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to mixer. My very expensive tone match by Bose just died on me. I had a Xenyx 802 and lent it to someone and they never returned it. This unit works very well with the Bose L1 system. Can't go wrong with this product
customer_reviews.author: Azucarpeach

customer_reviews.title: Price!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price is worth, wouldn't mind the model that is cheaper than this one. It is a great device to provide power to your XLR mic. Is a great mixer if you are starting up but just beware you get what you pay. There are better options for a higher price but for this price is the best one available.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: A nice little mixer!
customer_reviews.text: For what this does you can't go wrong for the price! I have a small recording setup and play guitar (and bass) with friends. This little mixer gets both of those jobs done right. Sure a more expensive mixer might be able to tweek your vocals or instruments more, but all I needed was a way to mix up to 4 inputs at at time and out put to my speakers and laptop for recording. It does all of those jobs well. There is no hum when the unit is on. I have two small grips though..and they are minor...the EQ isn't that great and the volume to the headphones is lower than I like. Maybe I'm going deaf.
customer_reviews.author: G.R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Need a small to medium size mixer for audio production ...
customer_reviews.text: Need a small to medium size mixer for audio production or projects? This is your 'go to' item right here. I was able to contain 2 mic's, an external sound input and a live telephone line all in one segment, with ease. Sound quality is outstanding! For the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Some of the holes are too big!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the holes to plug in are too big. You need to know what to do about it. My BF was pissed when he have to fix his own equipment to make this one work.
customer_reviews.author: mely71212

customer_reviews.title: Mic to PA good, mixer to PA even better
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with a PA speaker. Mic to PA good, mixer to PA even better, I had intended to use this and run through my in wall surround sound speakers but adjust mic levels so your not clipping you can barely hear them over the music. I will be attempting a reconfig with 1/4" trs to rca cables for output to home theater audio receiver. That's how I had it set up to a $150 karaoke machine with built in PA
customer_reviews.author: Henri J. Lanouette

customer_reviews.title: This mixer is great. after looking around
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is great. after looking around, i finally settled on this one because ti has the three band eq, unlike many other mixers in the price range which only have two. Plenty of inputs, plenty of outputs although i was slightly disappointing not to have xlr outputs and it is a little annoying having them straight up rather than out the back. The mixer has a little background noise but it becomes non noticeable once you start playing something through the speakers. Great little mixer, and i expect that it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Behringer Mixer: The Basics of Beginner's Podcast
customer_reviews.text: Even though it is basic for people who are new to podcasting. This is the Behringer 101 for beginner's of podcast. It is a great durable mixer. I would highly recommend this particular product.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Darryl L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: 4 month mixer board.
customer_reviews.text: Both Mic line inputs Failed after 4 months(static noise) . Also channel 3/4 Right input would destroy my cables I believe there was a short. Could not find the phone number to contact them on their site, Finally got ahold of some company in Nevada. sending it back through them. Like the portability of product... but that doesn't help when it doesn't work!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Roma

customer_reviews.title: Good audio board.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my intention, not sure if the audio output is super high quality but it gets the job done. I use it mainly for the Mic amps to amplify the signal going to the speaker like for a wedding and to play the wedding music.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Much better than MultiMix 4
customer_reviews.text: I liked it so much I bought a second one for our music teacher. She kept borrowing it to do recordings for recitals and solos. We use it for video broadcasting. It's a great portable sound board. I had two Alesis MultiMix 4's, and the power plugs stopped feeding juice at about the same time. Very disappointing. I feel the power inlets are much better on these Behringers, so I'm a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: jmerc

customer_reviews.title: It has great features, Top sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I Love this Mixer/Preamp! It has great features, Top sound quality! I originally bought a different model, but it didn't meet my needs. This is too good to be true for the price! I highly recommend this and all Behringer products!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features for the price, which is something Behringer is known for. But I'm returning it due to mid-range hiss. It seems to be mostly on the headphone output and the line outs are fairly quiet. I purchased a Yamaha MG06X instead. The Yamaha has less EQ control, but it does have built-in effects and both high and low impedance outputs. (They also have a slightly cheaper version that doesn't have the effects)
customer_reviews.author: biplanepilot

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say I purchased this unit about 2 years ago. It has been to private clubs, small venues and even used it for some YouTube recordings. WOW! Small, powerful, and just gets the job done. I can take this just about any where and it gets the job done. The only downer is the power supply hook up. Why do they use those little pins? Just be careful plugging this in and transport of the AC power supply it is a bit fragile.Other than that, great unit!
customer_reviews.author: Murl Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Good Small board
customer_reviews.text: A good option for a small, lightweight mixer for simple applications. Preamps are decent and all functions work well
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Want to like - defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked fine, then i began to get a lot of static - then the static became louder than the audio coming in. Then all the channels stopped mixing (sometimes) and I would only be able to record channel 1 with intermittent static when the others would occasionally kick on. I thought the problem was related to my cables and use of adapters but replacing them only gave the static a much higher fidelity. I want to like this mixer, it seems pretty great for the price, and I would normally give it a second chance and adjust my rating with the new one; but since its being shipped back, I figured I might as well upgrade too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Clem

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the other mini-mixer we got for my husband started having bad connection issues after only a few months of ownership. This mixer is way better. It gives him more options and is of much better quality. he is connecting an electric piano to some headphones, but also wants to hear his youtube lessons so that's a third connection to his computer. This mixer is the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little mixer Very low noise My only complaint is the stereo volume is not well matched at very low levels. Evens out at 1/4 turn up
customer_reviews.author: Knowitfixit

customer_reviews.title: Love this cute little thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this cute little thing! I use this one for my kids to practice whenever they have a part in church! easy to use but the unit doesn't have an on-off button. you really have to plug or unplug the cable whenever you want to turn it on or off. the part of the cable where you have to insert it to the unit is not so protected for whatever yanking movement that may happen during using the unit, so be careful not to damage it.
customer_reviews.author: Right Hand Drive

customer_reviews.title: Power cord
customer_reviews.text: Used it 4 times since it was received it on 1 May 2020. The power cord is always lose. The moment it moves the mixer loses power. Not a good buy. Waste of $90. Not recommended. There is no point in rating sound or volume control if the power is unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Dammin Senerat

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mixer with a lot of value built in
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mixer with a lot of value built in. The unit does everything I need and it fits in the compact space I need. Only drawback I see is that there is no power button. So that means I need to either unplug or turn off a surge protector when I'm not using the item. This is definitely a negative.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: This thing is gold it's so good. I've had it for years
customer_reviews.text: Somebody said you get what you pay for with this product. This thing is gold it's so good. I've had it for years. I use it as a utility device: mixer, eq, volume control. Right now I'm using it as part of an amp front end for my guitar going into M-Audio studio monitors. Offers me all the controls I need - no noise. This is a company I learn to love more and more as I purchase their products. Amazing quality at rock bottom prices. You get gold for almost nothing...
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good, but for the price, GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Good is the perfect word to describe this, until you take into account the price. Then it's surprisingly excellent. My only complaint is the power socket/plug mating is less than super tight and if you move the unit or the power cord around a lot, it tends to disconnect. This isn't an issue once you're set up, obviously. I just worry about its lifespan if it's this loose to begin with. Maybe flattening the plug a bit will cause it to mate tighter. This problem isn't even bad enough for me to try that, though.
customer_reviews.author: Flavian

customer_reviews.title: Turned kareoke into a group event.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. I doubt this was intended for my purposes but my kids really enjoy kareoke. This set allowed me to control 4 mics, the kareoke machine output and feed it all into one mini amp speaker. The sound is great and I can tune each mic for the singer. Love it. Inexpensive investment for a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Randy J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the first mixer/audio interface i've ever personally owned. so far its been great, if you turn it up toomuch it can get a bit distorty but other than that its awesome. so many features and options to mess and play with this bad boy. do not regret purchasing this one bit. awesome and easy to use for a starter , and affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Poole

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and usable
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer! Have owned a few behringer mixers and headphone amps in the past and never had an issue with any of them. Only reason I don’t own the others was because I sold them or gave them to band mates. The 802 is perfect for a small pa setup, recording routing or as I do running inputs into a stereo looper(Boss Rc-1). Worth the reasonable price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Hank F.

customer_reviews.title: Behringer Reclaims The Belt
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mixer for my needs. I use the aux send as a mono sum to my mixcube and the control room out to my mains. Then I use the tape out, Stereo RCA-Dual 1/4" to send back into my interface to record computer audio. Slightly smaller footprint than a magazine.
customer_reviews.author: Hexspa

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer. Only issue I have with it is that the power cord comes out very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: This is a small but great thing you should have at home for your family ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a small but great thing you should have at home for your family and friendly parties. I use it with my powered ROCKVILLE 15'' speakers GREAT SOUND. I'm able to hook everything (Phone, tablets, LAPTOPS, MICROPHONES) and get a great party. Go on don't hesitate to put your money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mackee

customer_reviews.title: Professional unit in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Professional unit in a small package. Works great for small applications (home mixing/recording). Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It works, and now its collecting dust in a closet. I guess I should get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Power Connector.
customer_reviews.text: Good preamp, but power connector to the unit is poorly designed and falls out just when you don't want to!!! Looked at several other suppliers locally (Best Buy, etc) and theirs also had same problem. Not a good example of normally very fine products from Behringer. I would highly recommend you not buy this product unless you have assurance to be able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy product
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy product especially the power cord connector. The housing on it doesn't fit correctly it keeps on coming loose and powers out. Even when i improvised to keep it connected something doesn't seem to be wired right, the sounds would pop several times followed by a stutter noise. Switched to a Yamaha mixer to see if it was a cable or wiring problem but that worked perfectly. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: ElephantGun20

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer board for DJ and basic live sound
customer_reviews.text: Great Mixer board for DJ and basic live sound. The only thing that I wish it had was a mute button for each channel as the only way to turn off a channel is to turn the gain all the way down which is not ideal when playing music off to different devices when DJing. An On/Off switch would also be nice. Has to be unplugged to turn it off. Excellent product in the 6 months I have owned it.
customer_reviews.author: eagletalon2016

customer_reviews.title: Issue with item right away then stopped working all together ...
customer_reviews.text: Issue with item right away then stopped working all together less then a month later. Should have returned when I had the chance. Only used 3 or so times and was never moved off the table
customer_reviews.author: lysha

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Did it's job for a couple weeks, then would power up but not send or receive any signal. Don't ever buy behringer.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Consistent mixer
customer_reviews.text: Use it on every gig as my personal monitor setup. Able to have main mix, loops, and extrs audio input to go over material. Also run my lopps from this board to the main mix. It gives great sound and I always feel in control.
customer_reviews.author: lionell

customer_reviews.title: Good feature set, but not very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Good feature set, but failed 3 years out with only minimal use. Specifically, mine started giving a bunch of white noise on the left main output channel. I double-checked cabling and attached devices and the problem is definitely in the mixer. I was able to connect my devices to the 'control room' outputs instead of the main outputs and work around this issue, but still it sucks to have a device that isn't fully functional.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Returning it. Not happy very poor quality and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work and instructions do not explain how to use it at all. Not happy. Returning it. Now it’s gonna take weeks to get the replacement. I might just return that too.
customer_reviews.author: R C

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression wasn't great. The outer box it was shipped in was fine. But, the factory box was a little flimsy looking. When I opened it though, everything was packed tight and was fine. I am able to hook up my iPod and/or laptop to a speaker and it works fine. When trying to use with those devices and go through a main board though, could have used some more instruction in the manual. Overall, a good product that with more experience or maybe more technical manual instructions, will do exactly what I need it to do. I do have to agree with some of the other reviewers, an on/off switch would be very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: P. Elswick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, Simply Excelent.
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box the Behringer Xenyx 802 was ready to go. Coupled with my Carvin 2500 watts power amp this little giant was up to the task of powering my keyboard and 5 microphones in our modest size church sanctuary. The fact that this piece of equipment does not have sliding switches means that it will last for a very long time, debugging the awkward scratching noise that tend to plague sliding switch equipment after a while. I recommend this product to anyone who has a garage band to the professional who has a small recording studio or even small and mid sized churches. Again it is truly an excellent Product.
customer_reviews.author: Desborne O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Not a Mackie, but it's okay for limited use.
customer_reviews.text: Served me well during a recent 13-gig run without my usual P.A. rig. I missed the flexibility/quality of my trusty ancient Mackie 1202s, but it worked out. That wall-wart power adaptor makes me quite nervous, I might buy another as a back-up in case the connector pin breaks or something.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Placid/Houston Musician

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: I probably over-bought when I got this, as I only needed to connect my Heil Sound "The Fin" microphone to my computer, but now I have room to grow, and it does exactly what I need now. Plug the XLR cable from the mic into the top left port, run a dual-RCA-plug-to-3.5mm-Male-plug cable from the CD/Tape output ports to the "line in" (blue) plug in the back of the computer, turn everything on, and boom, you can record right into the free software Audacity makes. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy self explanatory setup and use. I use it with my usb preamp for my pc and music production software, output to my studio monitors and my other audio ins and outs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Great home studio
customer_reviews.text: The brain of the operation. Great home studio, entry level but with good quality. Combine it with matching mic's and cables and you have a handy studio
customer_reviews.author: Ellie B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Compact, great price and functions as well as much higher priced mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying! Ended up getting this one and all that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheaper non brand name mixer first. My speakers were always humming, especially when no music was being played. Very annoying! Ended up getting this one and all that is gone. It's a great board and have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Pauls

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed...
customer_reviews.text: This little unit is perfect for my small home studio setup. I use it as a mini 'Master Mixer' and performs all the functions & features admirably! I especially like the nice, warm British EQ mic inputs for my vocals & acoustic instruments (I'm a multi-instrumentalist that combines organic & electronic elements to my sonic tapestry). The 2-bus 2-track & main mix functions allow for flexibility to add & subtract certain sound sources at the push of a button, and it's small enough to fit snugly into my 3-tier desktop workstation. A great deal for under $50!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE MIXER
customer_reviews.text: ITS SMALL AND AWESOME. It produces great sound for my podcast
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up everything with no problems
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a used model for slightly cheaper. After getting it in it looked new for the most part. After getting everything hooked up how i wanted. It was easy to set up everything with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Finch

customer_reviews.title: First Time Using a Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I previously was using a typical desktop microphone to record my voice narrations into my computer. It always had a tinny sound or distorted voice sound. Using this with a Audio-Technica ATR-1300 microphone has improved it very much. It also has the option to use a microphone that requires power and supply that power for the microphone.
customer_reviews.author: SpJoRuss

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it two days and already shipped it back, the sound quality coming from the mixer was poor and the microphone plug didn’t work for my equipment
customer_reviews.author: MINJA

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect via usb to computer
customer_reviews.text: There are better mixers out there for about the same price. I would look at Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Coolest Cutter At Camp

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price
customer_reviews.text: Considering the upward trend in pricing on entry level audio electronics as of late (thanks to podcasting...) this unit easily satisfies a multitude of requirements at a bargain price. The build quality is on par with other Behringer products (read: all but perfect), noise is not an issue (SNR 110dB), the "British" (haha) style EQ is clean and the thing just works. I too complain of no power button. A soft-on toggle/rocker would have been a nice addition, given the recommended power-on procedure (Connect power supply to board, then plug supply into the wall) but I suppose it could be easily solved with a remote control outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built Solid, Uses great.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic low budget mixer for the home studio. As mentioned a thousand times no power button but i have it hooked up to a powerstrip which runs my setup i turn off at night anyway. A little pop when adjusting levels so realtime adjusting is not practical. Great preamp makes my Shure SM58 sound clean. More than sufficient input output ports. And this little cost efficient devil is SOLID. Built well, and uses great. If your looking for pro level spend a bit more, but if you have a small home studio, podcast studio, or some other small enterprise audio this little devil is your saving grace.
customer_reviews.author: EarlTheLibertarianDingo

customer_reviews.title: The product is reliable.Good quality materials and performance.
customer_reviews.text: I blends with my electronic set up very good. Give me additional options in the sound department.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Robles Roche

customer_reviews.title: Affordable mixer for home studio
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer for small home studios. Preamps are mostly clear. I suggest running a click track when recording vocals, as a small amount of noise shows in blank space. Overall, a decent mixer. Use it to run my Korg gear, as well as record vocals, and dry guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Blasingame

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginner
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is not what it said to be as it's not connected to the computer and the instruction is not easy to follow and the way it draw out. overall this brand is not good in quality. I have to returned it. Not recommend for beginner like me
customer_reviews.author: Danika lam

customer_reviews.title: Geat mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good mixer. Good quality. Sound quality is great. Lots of bang for the buck. I recommend for a good starter mixer. The only concern is the power cable, the connector should have a better connector. I am concerned that plugging and uplugging the power cord will cause the connection to wear out very quickly. Great for a beginner DJ.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG A BONHAM

customer_reviews.title: Useful as Pre-Amp too if you want to use it that way.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as my pre-amp to a big Crown amplifier, I have a few inputs a guitar and a mic and an electronic drum kit going in and it works very well. You can adjust the channels separately and the output is making my amp very happy. Knobs make this VERY EASY to use so you won't have to slow down much during a gig.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Kukler

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I use it for..
customer_reviews.text: Using this mixer to preamp audio from a Laptop PC running V-DJ software and microphones intoand. Sounds great, Just using this setup for family functions and Weddings but it is a good starter setup with room to expand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mendes

customer_reviews.title: A great little mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to figure out. But once I did. It works great. I use this with my Twitch setup. I have audio come from the computer to hear any notifications while I play my xbox audio from the controller through it, all leading to my headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound control
customer_reviews.text: I have a dual PC setup. One PC is a streaming PC, the other is a gaming PC. By channeling the sound from both PCs to this board I have complete control and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Satter

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Its basic but fully functional for my use. I really love the phantom power for my condensor mic and the ability to control the volume from the effects from my behringer fx unit. Easy hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick

customer_reviews.title: I bought this mixer and it worked great for the short time I had it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer and it worked great for the short time I had it. However, this mixer wasn't enough for my needs and I ended up returning it and purchasing theinstead.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W.

product_meta.title: Behringer Xenyx 802 Premium 8-Input 2-Bus Mixer with Xenyx Mic Preamps and British EQs
product_meta.description:
Behringer Xenyx 802 Premium 8-Input 2-Bus Mixer with Xenyx Mic Preamps and British EQs. Never use unbalanced XLR connectors (PIN 1 and 3 connected) on the MIC input connectors when using the phantom power supply 

Signal-to-noise ratio: 110 dB / 112 dB A-weighted (0 dBu In @ +22 dB GAIN
feature_bullets: Premium ultra-low noise, high headroom analog mixer
2 state-of-the-art XENYX Mic Preamps comparable to stand-alone boutique preamps
Neo-classic "British" 3-band EQs for warm and musical sound
1 post fader FX send per channel for external FX devices
1 stereo aux return for FX applications or as separate stereo input

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,429 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
